results.title: Integrated curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Lily Steiner, Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Shows how an integrated curriculum can operate in classrooms with children ranging from preparatory to years five and six. It shows how different areas of the curriculum can be integrated to promote learning.

results.title: Integrated Alternative Health Care
results.brief_description: We are shown the full range of medical and educational programs with their new approach to integrated care, which has also been called alternative medicine. The film focuses on the role of paramedics and on their education and their motivation.

results.title: Insult to Injury
results.brief_description: A Greek factory employee injured his back at work. This program examines the problems that he encountered with doctors, Workers’ Compensation, and Unions, and their attitudes towards him.

results.title: Instrumental program
results.creator_credit: F Whitman Trecartin, Rex Tasker and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Halifax Music”.
Displays some of the talents developed by students within the Halifax School Music Department system. From choral groups to jazz bands these youngsters have fun with their music and in so doing seem to involve their audiences in that enjoyment.

results.title: Instrument
results.brief_description:
Jem Cohen is a New York-based producer working in 16mm and 8mm film and video. His poetic, often ephemeral, work is marked by a blurring of the distinctions between documentary, narrative, and experimental genres. Cohen frequently shoots in hundreds of locations without any additional crew, in the tradition of documentary street photographers such as Robert Frank. His projects include collaborations with poets, writers, and bands such as R.E.M. and Fugazi, creating alternatives to generic and commodified ‘music video.’
‘Instrument’ is a collaboration between Jem Cohen and the Washington DC band Fugazi, the project covers the ten year period from the bands inception in 1987. Far from a traditional documentary, the project is a musical document: a portrait of musicians at work.

His projects include collaborations with poets, writers, and bands such as R.E.M. and Fugazi, creating alternatives to generic and commodified ‘music video.’
